storyInfo: The arborbeast mother that Andoain has been nursing dies, but his sorrow is soon wiped away. He realizes that the Matriarch has promised him a terrifying future. Federico stands off against the Sanktas errari, eventually permitting them to enter the city to assist him.

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Cardinal Lemuen...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I'm afraid you'll have to find another way to address me now.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: And I was under the impression that the Curia wasn't letting anyone visit me. Isn't that right?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I put in a report.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I was only just created. It's only natural that I would seek my predecessor's advice.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Haha. You've adapted quickly, Cardinal Amos.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I thought you said you didn't really have aspirations.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Cardi... Seniora. I didn't come to gloat. Our relationship was never cloak and dagger, was it?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: But if you came to ask about Lemuel, I've already said this many timesâ€”I have no idea where she is.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: It's something else that I want to ask about.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Did you sacrifice your career only to protect your sister? Or did you truly believe what she said...?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: From the Nativity, to the Summit of Nations... something doesn't seem right about all that has been happening in Laterano lately. It's like we've come down with a sort of illness.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: They're the same thing to me.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Th-There's something I want you to see.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Amos turns his terminal on and hands it to Lemuen.
What's this?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Application to join the Legati. I wanted to be a Legatus, and get assigned to BolÃ­var.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: You want to leave Laterano? Why?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: My wife and I...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: We had a big fight and I left. When I came back, she had gone on a mission, dealing with Sarkaz raiders attacking caravans in the wilderness near Kazdel.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: She's always been like that, never listening to people. It was winter. I figured she wouldn't be back until spring, and I was thinking about doing something to make up for my leaving...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: You know the rest about what happened to her. Fallen, exiled, et cetera.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: It was convenient that the Seventh Tribunal was responsible for national security and foreign relations. It took a long time, but I finally found out where she went. I thought...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: What do you mean, though, when you said something didn't feel right?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The selection standards for Legati are extremely high. A man of my ability didn't really have much hope... so the application sat in my draft box for a long time, until...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: You approved your own application when you were created cardinal of the Seventh Tribunal?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Y-Yes.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Reverend Patrizion said all I needed was an opportunity when he informed me of my imminent creation...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I'm sure he meant something else, but this is all I could think of.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: However, the moment I approved the application, it just... vanished. No notice of rejection, no record to be found anywhere.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: It just disappeared from my terminal, l-like it never existed.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: There was no way the application would have gone through. I would not be allowed to resign my cardinalate and become a Legatus so quickly.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Besides, all the Legati have been recalled to Laterano. I wouldn't be able to go and see Aurela, even if I really did become one.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: For me, approving the application wasn't even about making up for anything... it was just a small, insignificant comfort.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Who would want to wipe away such a small comfort?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: For me... that was enough to make me question if this Laterano is real.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Maybe... your sister was right.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Have you told anyone else?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: N-No. I couldn't sleep last night... you were the only one I could talk to about this.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: This isn't some newfangled interrogation technique, is it, Cardinal Amos?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You can trust me, Seniora Lemuen.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: We both have things that truly matter to us. Few things.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: An interesting point, Senior Amos.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: By the way, there's an even bigger Nativity scheduled at the Shrine of Nurtury today.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: 'We prepare for death all our lives.'
Even in a place like Rocamarea, where everything is washed out by tides of plague and famine, an old man may lick his parched lips and say something to the effect before his eyes close forever.
Words as old as time, as they say. To some, they are an eulogy to wishes unfulfilled; to others, an utterance free of regret. But there is a common premise between the twoâ€”
Death is the conclusion to life.
(Looks up in confusion)
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: (Flaps wings anxiously)
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Indeed, child, your mother will answer no more.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: ...She has died.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: (Soft chirp)
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: The mother has breathed her last. Andoain gently closes her eyes.
The fledgling leans over. He is trembling, even the sheen of his hide darkened. Andoain places him on his own knee and looks into his eyes.
The fledgling's voice is mumbled. Andoain does not speak the language of beasts, but he can feel sorrow, like a current running beneath the calm surfaceâ€”the fledgling's and his own.
Death is accompanied by new birth. When your mother knew that her own life was beyond saving, she chose to leave the hope of life to you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: She used her last strength, and succeeded.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: This is your first lesson.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: (Soft chirp)
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Rocamarea, the town with the clock tower, the abbey in the wilderness, and now... I've experienced many such moments, and now I have another. Each experience brings deeper insight.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: All walk toward the inevitable end. That is why the continuity of meaning is so precious.
Death is a parting.
A gift from the departed to the living, the beginning of the living's own salvation.
Do not fear, child.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Lament and remember... I will do so with you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I will stay outside and leave her funeral to you, Andoain.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: What of the Matriarch?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: She is indisposed, preparing for the Nativity to bestow halos upon all the non-Sankta here... she sends her apologies.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: No matter.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: We have grown accustomed to welcoming new life with ceremony, while funerals are always simple... Tell the Matriarch that it will be a little while before I return to duty.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Are you alright?
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: The mother's passing was sudden. The child is young, and unaccustomed to such sorrow. I must stay by his side.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: No, it's you the Matriarch is worried for.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Matriarch said she and you had been with this mother for a long time. She understands the sorrow in your heart.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: You are a thinker. Every journey gives you inspiration, but also fatigue.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: As for the child... he is a miracle. He has the strength to emerge from darkness.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: The Matriarch wishes me to tell you that no new life in Laterano will ever succumb to calamity nor sorrow.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: They will be born equal, they will be brave, and they will be strong... Laterano will see to it.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Andoain feels the fledging arborbeast push against his arm. He wants to calm him down, but the fledgling pushes his hand away and spreads his wings.
The fledgling takes flight, landing on a comfort bell in the middle of the room, making a pleasant sound.
Andoain watches in confusion. He has worn a halo for decades, yet his eyes still struggle to adjust to the fledgling's dazzling light.
(Flaps wings forcefully)
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: (Loud cry)
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: He has been with the fledgling day and night. He knows what these movements mean.
The fledgling is inviting him to play.
The Nurturer, who can never turn down a child, stands stunned.
He wants to communicate his sorrow, decline this incomprehensible invitation in the most tactful way possible.
But eventually, he steps up and takes the young arborbeast's claw, dancing a waltz in the middle of the empty room along to the comfort bells.
The arborbeast's excited cries echo throughout the room. His feathers shine bright under the halo, showing its sheen unreservedly in the spinning circles.
Their steps grow quicker, and Andoain looks toward the body of the deceased mother, trying to ascertain his own emotions. Then he realizes with a startâ€”
He is no longer sad.
He is joyful as the fledgling, he is beautiful as the fledgling, he sings and dances for the future with a heart full of hope, just like the fledgling.
Their spinning steps draw beautiful circles on the ground and in the air.
Is... is this...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Is this what Sankta means?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Only the instinct to avoid pain...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But no right to sorrow and mourning?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Is this the Sankta? Is this the miracle of life?!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Nobody answers his hysterical call. His Matriarch is bestowing halo after halo upon the people in the Hall of Enlightenment.
He alone stops in his tracks. He recalls a funeral, one that should not exist in his memory.
A field of irises. A child. Cruel but sincere confessions and prayers. Ringing of bells.
Still no answer?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel A

attributes.content: Hey, Aurela?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel A

attributes.content: You don't believe me, you listen for yourself.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Ouch! The sound hurts my ears... it's just noise! I can't make out anything!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel A

attributes.content: What's going on, Aurela?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel B

attributes.content: You're asking me?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You're a gun-knight. Were, at least. You know more about these things than we do.
attributes.name: Fallen Angel B

attributes.content: You said it yourself, I was a gun-knight.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: The static is bad enough. You wanna add to the noise, and I know plenty of ways to shut you up.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Sister...
attributes.name: BolÃ­varian Child

attributes.content: Don't be afraid, Hugo.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: (Please, Aurela. The children are watching.)
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: (These Sanktas have come a long way after a terrible ordeal that left them with broken halos, and a heart full of fear, with no comfort in sight...)
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: The intercity net of Laterano has always been very stable, with dedicated personnel performing regular maintenance on communications equipment located in settlements outside the city.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: This emergency communication post is only three kilometers from the Lateran City. If any one of them is still working, this would be it, but I've sent a dozen hails through the special channel with no response.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Is Laterano really done for? Hah.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Could you try a few more times, Aurela?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: You look even more nervous than them.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Do I?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Nueda does not say more. A few children come over and grab the hem of her dress, staring forward with her.

The white walls of Laterano are already visible from this settlement. Impeccable as the clouds, it looks like the abode of a holy spirit who accidentally ventured into the mortal realm, a miracle that should not exist.
The pilgrims are but a stone's throw away. Dusty and tired, their broken halos and wings seem even darker in this wilderness.
The pilgrims have reached the end of their journey, but is it truly the end of their suffering?
That's it... Laterano...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Looks like the people in there can hardly even fend for themselves at this point. Get your things, we're going in.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You're right, we can't wait here forever. Let's go!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel A

attributes.content: But if we enter the city without the Curia's permission...
attributes.name: Fallen Angel B

attributes.content: Tell me, did we fallen sinners ever ask the Curia for permission when we decided to return?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Don't tell me you came back to repay Laterano's kindness. I'll put you first against the wall.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Stop.
You must not enter Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Look who we've got here. A Notarial Hall executor.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Are you Aurela?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You know who I am?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I looked you up in the Notarial Hall database after receiving your message.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Aurela, former citizen ID LC0073458, former captain of the Third Gun-Knights. You were tasked to escort a Lateran caravan through the northern wilderness in the winter of 1090, when you engaged a group of Sarkaz mercenaries in combat.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You completed your mission, but the nomadic abbey encountered a small-scale Catastrophe on your way back. The Sarkaz prisoners attempted an insurrection and were executed on the spot, by you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: When a fellow gun-knight attempted to record the events truthfully in a mission report, you threatened your cohort with a gun in order to hide your excessive use of force.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: In the chaos that ensued, you killed your cohort, resulting in you being stripped of citizenship and exiled from Laterano for life.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And what of it, Senior Executor? Are you trying to remind me that Laterano will never forget my sins?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Look at the hundreds of people here. Some are fallen angels who were exiled like me, some are errari who left the Holy City for different reasons...
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Some of them have never even seen the Holy City, growing up in a cesspit like BolÃ­var, yet still believing in the tenets of Laterano...
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Have you not seen their halos? Are they fallen, or are they sick? They've crossed mountains and rivers to come here, for an explanation, for any comfort they can find.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: And all the Lateran does is send a single executor to stop us from entering?!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: More and more errari Sanktas gather, surrounding Federico, pointing their weapons at him.
You'll keep us out because we left Laterano for too long and forgot how to live like other Sanktas?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari A

attributes.content: The Law punishes sinners, but what sin did I commit when all I did was live twenty honest years in Leithanien?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari B

attributes.content: If the Law is that cruel, then it's not us who should be punished. It's youâ€”you and your cohorts, tuskbeasts of the Law!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel A

attributes.content: I fell because you punished an innocent man! You've never used your power for good!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel B

attributes.content: Federico watches the crowd quietly.
The street lamps have lit at an inopportune time, casting eerie colors upon their faces. Fear, anxiety, anger, confusion, panic... all these emotions come together to twist their visages.
Their hands tremble as they hold their weapons. The tension is palpable in the air.
Federico is confident he can take out their leader quickly and suppress the rest by force, bringing the situation under control.
He has always done so. It has always worked.
Federico is an outstanding executor. He has been with the Notarial Hall for eight years. He knows what he is doing.
This is his third year as a saint. Other than a burnt flower and a few chance acquaintances, there is no one to guide him or instruct him.
Slowly, he moves his hand away from the gun at his beltâ€”making sure the tense crowd sees itâ€”while his eyes never leave them.
I did not come to repeat the judgment that Laterano once passed upon you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I am not here as a representative of the Notarial Hall, the Curia, nor any other official Lateran organ.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The reason you must not enter Laterano is because the city is currently affected by anomalies beyond comprehension. Your presence may cause the situation to further deteriorate.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will explain, but I need time.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia? You should not leave the Holy City.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Don't worry, I met the Doctor... and I am here on the Doctor's instructions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The Doctor's discovery confirms our hypothesis. All of Laterano is caught up in some kind of dream, but the anomalies in the dream are being reflected in reality.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A calamity has descended on the entire city.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Like the Kargereich invasion of ZwillingstÃ¼rme, after the disintegration of the Witch King's Pavillon?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Maybe. I don't fully understand it myself. But there is no doubt that millions of Laterans are being caught in a struggle between reality and illusion, and we need help.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The violators and errari...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A chance dissonance is often the beginning of an interesting variation.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I concur with the Doctor.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, if the calamity has engulfed all of Laterano, they are likely to enter the dream the moment they enter the city.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's why I came looking for you. And I brought my cello.
attributes.name: Arturia
